00005 bool addCamera(REFCLSID CLSIDcategory, WCHAR* filtername, IGraphBuilder *pGraph, IPin **outputPin) {
00006         // Create the System Device Enumerator.
00007         HRESULT hr;
00008         IBaseFilter* baseFilter = NULL;
00009         ICreateDevEnum *pSysDevEnum = NULL;
00010         hr = CoCreateInstance(CLSID_SystemDeviceEnum, NULL, CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER,
00011     IID_ICreateDevEnum, (void **)&pSysDevEnum);
00012 
00013         // Obtain a class enumerator for the specified category.
00014         IEnumMoniker *pEnumCat = NULL;
00015         hr = pSysDevEnum->CreateClassEnumerator(CLSIDcategory, &pEnumCat, 0);
00016 
00017         if (hr != S_OK)
00018                 return 0;
00019 
00020         // Enumerate the monikers.
00021         IMoniker *pMoniker;
00022         ULONG cFetched;
00023         bool found= false;
00024 
00025         while(pEnumCat->Next(1, &pMoniker, &cFetched) == S_OK && !found)
00026         {
00027                 IPropertyBag *pPropBag;
00028                 pMoniker->BindToStorage(0, 0, IID_IPropertyBag, (void **)&pPropBag);
00029 
00030                 // To retrieve the friendly name of the filter, do the following:
00031                 VARIANT varName;
00032                 VariantInit(&varName);
00033                 CString str;
00034                 hr = pPropBag->Read(L"FriendlyName", &varName, 0);
00035                 if (SUCCEEDED(hr))
00036                 {
00037                         str= varName.bstrVal;
00038 
00039                         SysFreeString(varName.bstrVal);
00040                 }
00041                 VariantClear(&varName);
00042 
00043             // To create an instance of the filter, do the following:
00044 
00045                 if (str == filtername) {
00046 
00047                         found= true;
00048                         hr= pMoniker->BindToObject(NULL, NULL, IID_IBaseFilter, (void**)&baseFilter);
00049                 }
00050 
00051                 // Clean up.
00052                 pPropBag->Release();
00053                 pMoniker->Release();
00054         }
00055 
00056         pEnumCat->Release();
00057 
00058         HRESULT h1 = pGraph->AddFilter( baseFilter, filtername);
00059         if(FAILED(h1) ) {
00060                 TCHAR tmp[100];
00061                 StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to connect %ls", filtername);
00062                 ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00063                 return 0;
00064         }
00065         outputPin[0]= GetPin(baseFilter, PINDIR_OUTPUT, 1);
00066     return 1;
00067 }
00068 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00069 bool addFilter(IBaseFilter* baseFilter, WCHAR* filtername, IGraphBuilder *pGraph,
00070                IPin **outputPin, int numberOfOutput) {
00071 
00072       // This function assumes the filter is already created
00073 
00074       TCHAR tmp[100];
00075       // Obtain the input pin.
00076 
00077       IPin* inputPin= GetPin(baseFilter, PINDIR_INPUT);
00078       if (!inputPin) {
00079 
00080         StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to obtain %ls input pin", filtername);
00081         ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00082         return 0;
00083       }
00084 
00085       // Connect the filter to the ouput pin.
00086                 HRESULT h1 = pGraph->AddFilter( baseFilter, filtername);
00087                 HRESULT h2 = pGraph->Connect(*outputPin, inputPin);
00088 
00089       if(FAILED(h1) ||
00090          FAILED(h2) )           
00091       {
00092 
00093         StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to connect %ls filter", filtername);
00094         ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00095         return 0;
00096       }
00097 
00098       SafeRelease(inputPin);
00099       SafeRelease(*outputPin);
00100 
00101       // Obtain the scene pin(s).
00102 
00103       for (int i=0; i<numberOfOutput; i++) {
00104 
00105         outputPin[i]= 0;
00106         outputPin[i]= GetPin(baseFilter, PINDIR_OUTPUT, i+1);
00107 
00108         if (!outputPin[i]) {
00109 
00110           StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to obtain %s scene pin (%d)", filtername, i);
00111           ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00112           return 0;
00113         }
00114       }
00115 
00116       SafeRelease(baseFilter);
00117 
00118       return 1;
00119 }

00121 bool addFilter(REFCLSID filterCLSID, WCHAR* filtername, IGraphBuilder *pGraph,
00122                IPin **outputPin, int numberOfOutput) {
00123 
00124       // Create the filter.
00125 
00126       IBaseFilter* baseFilter = NULL;

00128

00130           filterCLSID, NULL, CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER,
00131                 IID_IBaseFilter, (void**)&baseFilter)) || !baseFilter)
00132       {
00133         StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to create %ls filter", filtername);
00134         ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00135         return 0;
00136       }
00137 
00138       // Obtain the input pin.
00139

00161       SafeRelease(*outputPin);

00257 bool addFileWriter(WCHAR* filename, IGraphBuilder *pGraph, IPin **outputPin) {
00258 
00259       char tmp[100];
00260       IBaseFilter* pWriter = NULL;
00261       if(FAILED(CoCreateInstance(CLSID_FileWriter, NULL, CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER,
00262                 IID_IBaseFilter, (void**)&pWriter)) || !pWriter)
00263       {
00264         StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to create file writer (%ls)", filename);
00265         ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00266         return 0;
00267       }
00268 
00269       IFileSinkFilter2 *psink;
00270       pWriter->QueryInterface(IID_IFileSinkFilter2, (void **)&psink);
00271 
00272       psink->SetFileName(filename,NULL);
00273       psink->SetMode(AM_FILE_OVERWRITE);
00274 
00275       IPin* pWriterIn= GetPin(pWriter, PINDIR_INPUT);
00276       if (!pWriterIn) {
00277 
00278         StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to obtain writer input pin (%ls)", filename);
00279         ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00280         return 0;
00281       }
00282 
00283       if(FAILED(pGraph->AddFilter( pWriter, filename)) ||
00284          FAILED(pGraph->Connect(*outputPin, pWriterIn)) )           
00285       {
00286         ::MessageBox( NULL, "Unable to connect writer filter", "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00287         return 0;
00288       }
00289 
00290       SafeRelease(pWriter);
00291       SafeRelease(pWriterIn);
00292       SafeRelease(*outputPin);
00293 
00294       return 1;
00295 }
00296 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00297 // Returns the next available pin.
00298  
00299  IPin *GetPin(IBaseFilter *pFilter, PIN_DIRECTION PinDir)
00300 {
00301     BOOL       bFound = FALSE;
00302     IEnumPins  *pEnum;
00303     IPin       *pPin;
00304     IPin       *pPin2;
00305 
00306     pFilter->EnumPins(&pEnum);
00307     while(pEnum->Next(1, &pPin, 0) == S_OK)
00308     {
00309         PIN_DIRECTION PinDirThis;
00310         pPin->QueryDirection(&PinDirThis);
00311         if (PinDir == PinDirThis) {
00312 
00313             pPin->ConnectedTo(&pPin2); // is this pin
00314                                        // connected to another pin ?
00315             if (pPin2 == 0) {
00316               bFound= TRUE;
00317               break;
00318             }
00319         }
00320         pPin->Release();
00321     }
00322     
00323     pEnum->Release();
00324     return (bFound ? pPin : 0);  
00325 }
00326 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00327 // Returns the n-th pin (the first one being number 1).
00328  
00329 IPin *GetPin(IBaseFilter *pFilter, PIN_DIRECTION PinDir, int n)
00330 {
00331     BOOL       bFound = FALSE;
00332     IEnumPins  *pEnum;
00333     IPin       *pPin;
00334     int i=1;
00335 
00336     pFilter->EnumPins(&pEnum);
00337     while(pEnum->Next(1, &pPin, 0) == S_OK)
00338     {
00339         PIN_DIRECTION PinDirThis;
00340         pPin->QueryDirection(&PinDirThis);
00341         if (PinDir == PinDirThis) {
00342 
00343             if (i == n) {
00344 
00345               bFound= TRUE;
00346               break;
00347 
00348             } else {
00349 
00350               i++;
00351             }
00352         }
00353         pPin->Release();
00354     }
00355     
00356     pEnum->Release();
00357     return (bFound ? pPin : 0);  
00358 }
00359 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00360 void enumFilters(IGraphBuilder *pGraph, CArray<CString> names) {
00361 
00362       IEnumFilters *pEnum = NULL;
00363       IBaseFilter *pFilter;
00364       ULONG cFetched;
00365 
00366       pGraph->EnumFilters(&pEnum);
00367       while(pEnum->Next(1, &pFilter, &cFetched) == S_OK)
00368       {
00369         FILTER_INFO FilterInfo;
00370         char szName[256];
00371         CString fname;
00372 
00373         pFilter->QueryFilterInfo(&FilterInfo);
00374         WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, 0, FilterInfo.achName, -1, szName, 256, 0, 0);
00375         fname= szName;
00376         names.Add(fname);
00377 
00378         SafeRelease(FilterInfo.pGraph);
00379         SafeRelease(pFilter);
00380       }
00381 
00382       SafeRelease(pEnum);
00383 }
00384 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00385 IBaseFilter* getFilterByName(IGraphBuilder *pGraph, CString name) {
00386 
00387       IEnumFilters *pEnum = NULL;
00388       IBaseFilter *pFilter;
00389       ULONG cFetched;
00390           bool found= false;
00391 
00392       pGraph->EnumFilters(&pEnum);
00393       while(!found && pEnum->Next(1, &pFilter, &cFetched) == S_OK)
00394       {
00395         FILTER_INFO FilterInfo;
00396         char szName[256];
00397         CString fname;
00398 
00399         pFilter->QueryFilterInfo(&FilterInfo);
00400         WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, 0, FilterInfo.achName, -1, szName, 256, 0, 0);
00401         fname= szName;
00402 
00403         SafeRelease(FilterInfo.pGraph);
00404 
00405                 if (fname == name) {
00406 
00407                         found= true;
00408 
00409                 } else {
00410 
00411                         SafeRelease(pFilter);
00412                 }
00413       }
00414 
00415       SafeRelease(pEnum);
00416 
00417           if (found)
00418                   return pFilter;
00419           else
00420           return 0;
00421 }
00422 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00423 bool removeAllFilters(IGraphBuilder *pGraph) {
00424 
00425       IEnumFilters *pEnum = NULL;
00426       IBaseFilter *pFilter;
00427       ULONG cFetched;
00428       CArray< IBaseFilter* > filters;
00429       bool done= TRUE;
00430 
00431       pGraph->EnumFilters(&pEnum);
00432       while(pEnum->Next(1, &pFilter, &cFetched) == S_OK) {
00433 
00434         filters.Add(pFilter);
00435       }
00436 
00437       SafeRelease(pEnum);
00438 
00439           for (int i=0;i<filters.GetCount(); i++) {
00440 
00441         if (done && FAILED(pGraph->RemoveFilter(filters[i]))) {
00442 
00443          ::MessageBox( NULL, "Unable to remove filter", "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00444           done= FALSE;
00445           break;
00446         }
00447 
00448         SafeRelease(filters[i]);
00449       }
00450 
00451       return done;
00452 }

00455 void enumFilters(REFCLSID CLSIDcategory, CArray<CString>& names, CArray<CLSID>& clsidFilters) {
00456 
00457         // Create the System Device Enumerator.
00458         HRESULT hr;
00459         ICreateDevEnum *pSysDevEnum = NULL;
00460         hr = CoCreateInstance(CLSID_SystemDeviceEnum, NULL, CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER,
00461       IID_ICreateDevEnum, (void **)&pSysDevEnum);
00462 
00463         // Obtain a class enumerator for the specified category.
00464         IEnumMoniker *pEnumCat = NULL;
00465         hr = pSysDevEnum->CreateClassEnumerator(CLSIDcategory, &pEnumCat, 0);
00466 
00467         if (hr == S_OK)  {
00468 
00469                 // Enumerate the monikers.
00470                 IMoniker *pMoniker;
00471                 ULONG cFetched;
00472                 while(pEnumCat->Next(1, &pMoniker, &cFetched) == S_OK)
00473                 {
00474                         IPropertyBag *pPropBag;
00475                         pMoniker->BindToStorage(0, 0, IID_IPropertyBag, (void **)&pPropBag);
00476 
00477                         // To retrieve the friendly name of the filter, do the following:
00478                         VARIANT varName;
00479                         VariantInit(&varName);
00480                         hr = pPropBag->Read(L"FriendlyName", &varName, 0);
00481                         if (SUCCEEDED(hr))
00482                         {
00483                                 CString str(varName.bstrVal);
00484 
00485                         names.Add(str);
00486 
00487                                 SysFreeString(varName.bstrVal);
00488                         }
00489                         VariantClear(&varName);
00490 
00491             VARIANT varFilterClsid;
00492             varFilterClsid.vt = VT_BSTR;
00493 
00494             // Read CLSID string from property bag
00495             hr = pPropBag->Read(L"CLSID", &varFilterClsid, 0);
00496             if(SUCCEEDED(hr))
00497                         {
00498               CLSID clsidFilter;
00499 
00500               // Save filter CLSID
00501               if(CLSIDFromString(varFilterClsid.bstrVal, &clsidFilter) == S_OK)
00502                           {
00503                 clsidFilters.Add(clsidFilter);
00504                           }
00505 
00506               SysFreeString(varFilterClsid.bstrVal);
00507                         }
00508 
00509                         // To create an instance of the filter, do the following:
00510                         //   IBaseFilter *pFilter;
00511                         //   pMoniker->BindToObject(NULL, NULL, IID_IBaseFilter, (void**)&pFilter);
00512                         // Now add the filter to the graph. Remember to release pFilter later.
00513     
00514                         // Clean up.
00515                         pPropBag->Release();
00516                         pMoniker->Release();
00517                 }
00518 
00519                 pEnumCat->Release();
00520         }
00521 
00522         pSysDevEnum->Release();
00523 }

00525 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00526 IBaseFilter* addFilterByEnum(REFCLSID CLSIDcategory, CString filtername, IGraphBuilder *pGraph,
00527                IPin **outputPin, int numberOfOutput, bool returnIt) {
00528 
00529         // Create the System Device Enumerator.
00530         HRESULT hr;
00531       char tmp[100];
00532         IBaseFilter* baseFilter = NULL;
00533         ICreateDevEnum *pSysDevEnum = NULL;
00534         hr = CoCreateInstance(CLSID_SystemDeviceEnum, NULL, CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER,
00535     IID_ICreateDevEnum, (void **)&pSysDevEnum);
00536 
00537         // Obtain a class enumerator for the specified category.
00538         IEnumMoniker *pEnumCat = NULL;
00539         hr = pSysDevEnum->CreateClassEnumerator(CLSIDcategory, &pEnumCat, 0);
00540 
00541         if (hr == S_OK)  {
00542 
00543                 // Enumerate the monikers.
00544                 IMoniker *pMoniker;
00545                 ULONG cFetched;
00546                 bool found= false;
00547 
00548                 while(pEnumCat->Next(1, &pMoniker, &cFetched) == S_OK && !found)
00549                 {
00550                         IPropertyBag *pPropBag;
00551                         pMoniker->BindToStorage(0, 0, IID_IPropertyBag, (void **)&pPropBag);
00552 
00553                         // To retrieve the friendly name of the filter, do the following:
00554                         VARIANT varName;
00555                         VariantInit(&varName);
00556                         CString str;
00557                         hr = pPropBag->Read(L"FriendlyName", &varName, 0);
00558                         if (SUCCEEDED(hr))
00559                         {
00560                                 str= varName.bstrVal;
00561 
00562                                 SysFreeString(varName.bstrVal);
00563                         }
00564                         VariantClear(&varName);
00565 
00566                 // To create an instance of the filter, do the following:
00567 
00568                         if (str == filtername) {
00569 
00570                                 found= true;
00571                                 hr= pMoniker->BindToObject(NULL, NULL, IID_IBaseFilter, (void**)&baseFilter);
00572                         }
00573     
00574                         // Clean up.
00575                         pPropBag->Release();
00576                         pMoniker->Release();
00577                 }
00578 
00579                 pEnumCat->Release();
00580 
00581                 IPin* inputPin;
00582                 if (*outputPin != NULL) {
00583 
00584           // Obtain the input pin.
00585           inputPin= GetPin(baseFilter, PINDIR_INPUT);
00586                   if (!inputPin) {
00587 
00588            StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to obtain %ls input pin", filtername);
00589            ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00590            return 0;
00591                   }
00592             }
00593 
00594         // Add the filter to the graph.
00595 
00596         WCHAR *wfile= new WCHAR[filtername.GetLength()+1];
00597         MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, filtername, -1, wfile, 
00598                                                 filtername.GetLength()+1);
00599         if(FAILED(pGraph->AddFilter( baseFilter, wfile)))           
00600             {
00601             StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to add %ls filter", filtername);
00602             ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00603             return 0;
00604             }
00605 
00606         delete[] wfile;          
00607 
00608 
00609             if (*outputPin != NULL) {
00610           // Connect the filter to the ouput pin.
00611 
00612           if(FAILED(pGraph->Connect(*outputPin, inputPin)) )           
00613                   {
00614 
00615             StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to connect %ls filter", filtername);
00616             ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00617             return 0;
00618                   }
00619 
00620           // Release both pins.  We will set a new outputpin to be
00621           // returned in the next section of the function
00622           // Modified - Kent Feb 23 2003
00623           SafeRelease(*outputPin);
00624           SafeRelease(inputPin);
00625                 }        
00626 
00627         // Obtain the scene pin(s).
00628         // Change the scene pin passed in to be the sceneImg
00629         // pin of the newly added filter.
00630        for (int i=0; i<numberOfOutput; i++) {
00631 
00632                         outputPin[i]= 0;
00633                         outputPin[i]= GetPin(baseFilter, PINDIR_OUTPUT, i+1);
00634 
00635                         if (!outputPin[i]) {
00636 
00637                         StringCchPrintf(tmp, 100, "Unable to obtain %s scene pin (%d)", filtername, i);
00638                         ::MessageBox( NULL, tmp, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONINFORMATION );
00639                         return 0;
00640                         }
00641       }
00642         }
00643 
00644         pSysDevEnum->Release();
00645 
00646         if (returnIt) {
00647 
00648                 return baseFilter;
00649 
00650         } else {
00651 
00652         SafeRelease(baseFilter);
00653                 return 0;
00654         }
00655 }
00656 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00657 // Added - Kent Feb 23 2003, Updated Mar 10 2003
00658 bool changeCompressorOptions(IPin **outputPin, int numberOfOutput, int& iKeyFrames, int& iPFrames, double& dQuality)
00659 {
00660     // This function will check over each of the scene pins in the outputPin
00661     // array to see if any of them support the IAMVideoCompression interface
00662     // If the interface is supported on a pin, the properties of the compressor
00663     // will be found and displayed.  The given vaules for KeyFrames, PFrames, and
00664     // quality will be set if the compressor supports the options, and the given
00665     // values aren't -1.  If the value is -1 and the given option IS supported,
00666     // the default value will be used.  FALSE will be returned if there is a 
00667     // problem obtaining the interface, or a value for an option has been passed
00668     // but the compressor doesn't support that option.
00669 
00670     int i;
00671     HRESULT hr = E_FAIL;
00672     IPin *pPin = NULL;
00673     IAMVideoCompression *pCompress = NULL;
00674 
00675     long lCap;                     // Capability flags
00676     long lKeyFrameDef, lPFrameDef; // Default values
00677     double QualityDef;
00678     bool bResult = TRUE;        
00679 
00680     for (i=0; i < numberOfOutput; i++)
00681     {
00682         pPin = outputPin[i];
00683         hr = pPin->QueryInterface(IID_IAMVideoCompression, (void**)&pCompress);
00684         if (SUCCEEDED(hr))
00685             break;          // Interface found on pin, pCompress is valid.
00686     }
00687 
00688     if (SUCCEEDED(hr))
00689     {
00690         
00691         int cbVersion=0, cbDesc=0; // Size in bytes, not characters!
00692         hr = pCompress->GetInfo(0, &cbVersion, 0, &cbDesc, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00693         if (SUCCEEDED(hr))
00694         {
00695             // Fudge the values here since it seems that the operation of
00696             // IAMVideoCompression::GetInfo isn't quite as advertised.  The size
00697             // of the version and description are returned as zero, but using zero
00698             // length buffers with 0 size buffer length inputs results in an exception.
00699             // It seems safest to set both values to something reasonably large.
00700 
00701             WCHAR *pszVersion = new WCHAR[512];
00702             WCHAR *pszDesc = new WCHAR[512];
00703             cbVersion = 256;
00704             cbDesc = 256;
00705             // Get default values and capabilities.
00706             hr = pCompress->GetInfo(pszVersion, &cbVersion, pszDesc, &cbDesc, &lKeyFrameDef, &lPFrameDef,
00707                 &QualityDef, &lCap);
00708             delete[] pszVersion;
00709             delete[] pszDesc;
00710         }
00711         else
00712             bResult = FALSE;
00713 
00714         if (SUCCEEDED(hr))
00715         {
00716             // For any values that aren't -1, attempt to set the values
00717             // If the compressor doesn't support the option, return false
00718             if (iKeyFrames != -1)
00719             {
00720                 if (lCap & CompressionCaps_CanKeyFrame)
00721                 {
00722                     hr = pCompress->put_KeyFrameRate(iKeyFrames);
00723                     if (FAILED(hr))
00724                         bResult = FALSE;
00725                 }
00726                 else
00727                     bResult = FALSE;
00728 
00729             } else {
00730 
00731                                 iKeyFrames= lKeyFrameDef;
00732                         }
00733     
00734             if (iPFrames != -1)
00735             {
00736                 if (lCap & CompressionCaps_CanBFrame)
00737                 {
00738                     hr = pCompress->put_PFramesPerKeyFrame(iPFrames);
00739                     if (FAILED(hr))
00740                         bResult = FALSE;
00741                 }
00742                 else
00743                     bResult = FALSE;
00744 
00745             } else {
00746 
00747                                 iPFrames= lPFrameDef;
00748                         }
00749     
00750             if (dQuality >= 0.0)
00751             {
00752                 if (lCap & CompressionCaps_CanQuality)
00753                 {
00754                     hr = pCompress->put_Quality(dQuality);
00755                     if (FAILED(hr))
00756                         bResult = FALSE;
00757                 }
00758                 else
00759                     bResult = FALSE;
00760 
00761             } else {
00762 
00763                                 dQuality= QualityDef;
00764                         }
00765         
00766         }
00767         else
00768             bResult = FALSE;
00769 
00770         SafeRelease(pCompress);
00771         return bResult;
00772     }
00773 
00774     return false;
00775 }
00776 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00777 // Added by Kent - Mar 16 2003
00778 bool changeVideoCaptureOptions(IBaseFilter* pVideoSource, long lParam, long lValue, long lFlags)
00779 {
00780     // This function takes a pointer to the video capture filter and 
00781     // sets the specified property to the specified value, using the given
00782     // flags.  If the option cannot be set for some reason, FALSE is returned,
00783     // otherwise the function returns TRUE.  FALSE may be returned in the
00784     // case that the property is not available for this device, or
00785     // the given value is out of range.
00786 
00787     // lParam is the property from the VideoProcAmpProperty enumeration that
00788     // you would like to change.  lValue contains the new value to set for this
00789     // property.
00790 
00791     // The lFlags variable can have the value 0 or 1, with 1 indicating that the
00792     // specified parameter is controlled automatically, and 0 indicating otherwise.
00793     // This feature is not available for all parameters.  If the auto setting is 
00794     // used, the value specified it ignored.  If lFlags is not passed to the function,
00795     // 0, or non-automatic, is assumed.
00796 
00797     IAMVideoProcAmp* pVideoProcAmp = NULL;
00798     HRESULT hr = E_FAIL;
00799 
00800     hr = pVideoSource->QueryInterface(IID_IAMVideoProcAmp, (void**)&pVideoProcAmp);
00801 
00802     if (FAILED(hr))
00803         return FALSE;
00804 
00805     // Have interface to VideoProcAmp, attempt to change settings
00806     hr = pVideoProcAmp->Set(lParam, lValue, lFlags);
00807 
00808     if (FAILED(hr))
00809     {
00810         SafeRelease(pVideoProcAmp);
00811         return FALSE;
00812     }
00813 
00814     return TRUE;
00815 }
00816 // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00817 bool changeVideoCaptureOptionsByName(WCHAR* wcVideoSource, IFilterGraph* pGraph, long lParam, long lValue, long lFlags)
00818 {
00819     // This function is almost identical to changeVideoCaptureOptions, except
00820     // that it wraps the finding of the video capture device, given the name
00821     // of the device.
00822 
00823     bool bResult = FALSE;
00824     HRESULT hr = E_FAIL;
00825 
00826     IBaseFilter* pVideoSource = NULL;
00827     hr = pGraph->FindFilterByName(wcVideoSource, &pVideoSource);
00828     if (FAILED(hr))
00829         return FALSE;
00830     bResult= changeVideoCaptureOptions(pVideoSource, lParam, lValue, lFlags);
00831     SafeRelease(pVideoSource);
00832     return bResult;
00833 }
